intro: Bursa prostii, commonly known as the crested spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive yellow-orange flowers surrounded by brightly colored bracts. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas. Bursa prostii has a low-growing habit with succulent, fleshy stems and leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It is a perennial plant that produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds.
